verses.text: Now the sons of Reuben and the sons of Gad had very large flocks and herds. They saw that the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead was indeed a place suitable for livestock.
verses.comment: Jazer and Gilead were prime grazing areas east of the Jordan.

verses.text: So the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben came and said to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the leaders of the congregation:
verses.comment: They approach the ruling leadership for a request.

verses.text: "Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
verses.comment: List of cities in Moabite territory recently conquered.

verses.text: the land that the LORD struck down before the congregation of Israel, is good land for livestock, and your servants have livestock."
verses.comment: They argue for its suitability and their need.

verses.text: They said, "If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants as a possession. Do not make us cross over the Jordan."
verses.comment: They seek exemption from crossing into Canaan.

verses.text: But Moses said to the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben, "Should your brothers go to war while you remain here?
verses.comment: Moses responds with concern for fairness.

verses.text: Why will you discourage the heart of the people of Israel from going over into the land that the LORD has given them?
verses.comment: Reference to the past discouragement by the spies.

verses.text: This is what your fathers did, when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to see the land.
verses.comment: Points to previous generation's lack of faith.

verses.text: For when they went up to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the heart of the people of Israel from going into the land that the LORD had given them.
verses.comment: Reference to the failed spy mission.

verses.text: The LORD's anger was kindled on that day, and He swore, saying:
verses.comment: Referencing God's oath.

verses.text: "Surely none of the men who came up out of Egypt, from twenty years old and upward, shall see the land that I swore to give to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, because they have not faithfully followed me,
verses.comment: God’s judgment on the Exodus generation.

verses.text: except Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua the son of Nun, for they have fully followed the LORD."
verses.comment: The two faithful spies.

verses.text: The LORD's anger burned against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until all the generation that had done evil in the LORD's sight was gone.
verses.comment: Explains the purpose of the forty years of wandering.

verses.text: Now look, you have risen in your fathers' place, a brood of sinful men, to increase still more the fierce anger of the LORD against Israel.
verses.comment: Moses accuses them of repeating past failures.

verses.text: If you turn away from following Him, He will again leave this people in the wilderness, and you will destroy all these people."
verses.comment: Warning of consequences.

verses.text: Then they came near to him and said, "We will build sheepfolds here for our livestock and cities for our children.
verses.comment: They propose a compromise.

verses.text: But we ourselves will be armed and ready to go before the people of Israel until we have brought them to their place. Our little ones will live in the fortified cities because of the inhabitants of the land.
verses.comment: They will fight with Israel before settling.

verses.text: We will not return to our homes until each of the people of Israel has received his inheritance.
verses.comment: Pledge of solidarity.

verses.text: For we will not have an inheritance with them on the other side of the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on this east side of the Jordan."
verses.comment: They reiterate their intent to settle east of Jordan.

verses.text: So Moses said to them, "If you will do this—if you will arm yourselves to go before the LORD to the war,
verses.comment: Conditional acceptance by Moses.

verses.text: and every armed man of yours will cross over the Jordan before the LORD until He has driven out His enemies from before Him,
verses.comment: Requirement to aid in conquest.

verses.text: and the land is subdued before the LORD, then afterward you may return and be free from obligation before the LORD and before Israel, and this land will be your possession before the LORD.
verses.comment: Promise that they will be blameless if they fulfill their vow.

verses.text: But if you will not do so, then see, you have sinned against the LORD; and be sure your sin will find you out.
verses.comment: "Be sure your sin will find you out"—a well-known warning.

verses.text: Build cities for your little ones and folds for your sheep, and do what you have promised."
verses.comment: Emphasizes fulfilling their commitment.

verses.text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben said to Moses, "Your servants will do as my lord commands.
verses.comment: They agree to Moses’ terms.

verses.text: Our little ones, our wives, our livestock, and all our cattle will remain there in the cities of Gilead,
verses.comment: They clarify who will stay.

verses.text: but your servants, every one armed for war, will cross over before the LORD to battle, as my lord says."
verses.comment: Agreement to fight alongside the others.

verses.text: So Moses gave orders concerning them to Eleazar the priest, and to Joshua the son of Nun, and to the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the people of Israel.
verses.comment: Moses establishes official leadership succession and instruction.

verses.text: Moses said to them, "If the sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben, every armed man, will cross the Jordan with you before the LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
verses.comment: Formalizes the terms of the deal.

verses.text: But if they do not cross over armed with you, then they shall have possessions among you in the land of Canaan."
verses.comment: Contingency for if they fail to abide by the agreement.

verses.text: The sons of Gad and the sons of Reuben answered, saying, "What the LORD has said to your servants, we will do.
verses.comment: Their promise.

verses.text: We will cross over armed before the LORD into the land of Canaan, and we will have our possession on this side of the Jordan."
verses.comment: Their commitment restated.

verses.text: So Moses gave to them, to the sons of Gad, to the sons of Reuben, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, the land, with its cities and territories, the cities of the surrounding land.
verses.comment: Now includes the half-tribe of Manasseh in the inheritance.

verses.text: The sons of Gad built Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
verses.comment: Building and fortifying these cities.

verses.text: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
Beth-nimrah and Beth-haran as fortified cities, and sheepfolds for flocks.
The sons of Reuben built Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
Nebo, and Baal-meon (their names being changed), and Sibmah. And they gave other names to the cities that they built.
verses.comment: Some of the names of these towns were changed after conquest.

verses.text: The sons of Machir the son of Manasseh went to Gilead, took it, and drove out the Amorites who were there.
verses.comment: The half-tribe of Manasseh also takes territory.

verses.text: Moses gave Gilead to Machir the son of Manasseh, and he lived there.
verses.comment: Manasseh's clan's inheritance.

verses.text: Jair the son of Manasseh went and captured their villages, and called them Havvoth-jair.
verses.comment: Jair is famous for these towns.

verses.text: Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages, and called it Nobah, after his own name.
verses.comment: Nobah is named after its conqueror.
